learning_outcomes.description: Describe and explain scientific concepts, theories, models and systems and their limitations
Apply understanding of scientific concepts, theories, models and systems within their limitations
Communicate understandings, findings, arguments and conclusions

assessments.task_description: Students complete an open-book online quiz during Week 5 and Week 10. Students have one attempt at each quiz.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Refer to UQ College Assessment Extensions, Exam Deferrals and Late Penalty Policy and Procedure.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Experimental practical work is an integral part of any Biology course. Students will demonstrate understanding by completing an open-book online quiz after each lab session. Students have one attempt for each quiz.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Create and present a poster to share information about a research project on a chosen topic.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Students either attend a field trip to UQ’s Moreton Bay Research Station or complete independent field work. Students carry out a variety of field work activities and then work groups to prepare and deliver a presentation of findings (max 10 mins) for a selection of the field work activities. Presentation slides must be submitted individually via Turnitin before each presentation.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
